707859f-a.text:
Second Avenue, northward from E. 39th Street (lower foreground and not seen) as viewed from atop No. 31l E. 38th Street. In the foreground is a clearance between 39th and 40th Streets and which is shown solely in No. 2. To the north are structures around 42nd Street; the News Building being that on the left. Beyond this is the Crystal Building at the S.W. corner of 43rd Street. To the right are units of Tudor City with its Hotel Woodstock only partially shown. Note the slight widening of the "El" tracks
at the 42nd Street station.
September 11, 1931
Views 1 and 2
P.L. Sperr

707859f-b.text:
Second Avenue, northward from E. 39th Street (lower foreground and not seen) as viewed from atop No. 31l E. 38th Street. In the foreground is a clearance between 39th and 40th Streets and which is shown solely in No. 2. To the north are structures around 42nd Street; the News Building being that on the left. Beyond this is the Crystal Building at the S.W. corner of 43rd Street. To the right are units of Tudor City with its Hotel Woodstock only partially shown. Note the slight widening of the "El" tracks
at the 42nd Street station.
September 11, 1931
Views 1 and 2
P.L. Sperr

707862f-a.text:
Second Avenue, at the N. E. corner of East 39th Street, showing the extensive cleared space there. Part of this site is used as a car parking lot. Across same appear units of Tudor City and a generating plant of the Consolidated Edison Company.
June 7, 1940
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr

707862f-b.text:
Second Avenue, at the N. E. corner of East 39th Street, showing the extensive cleared space there. Part of this site is used as a car parking lot. Across same appear units of Tudor City and a generating plant of the Consolidated Edison Company.
June 7, 1940
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr

707863f-a.text:
Second Avenue, east side, between 39th and 40th Streets, Edison stacks across clearing on east side of Second Avenue.
April 8, 1931
P. L. Sperr

712525f-a.text:
East 39th Street, north side, east from (No. 331), but not including Second Ave., to the East River. Prominently shown is one of the power houses of the N.Y. Edison Co. Plant.

April 8, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

712534f-a.text:
39th Street, east from but not including Second Avenue.
April 8, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

712535f-a.text:
(1)
39th Street, north side, east of Second Avenue, where buildings have just been demolished; the view is northwest, showing the Chanin, Chrysler, and Daily News Buildings.

September 11, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same and showing the rears of Nos. 314 to 322 East 40th Street.

September 11, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

(1)

712536f-a.text:
E. 39th Street (foreground, center) west from Second Avenue as viewed from the roof top of No. 301 E. 38th Street. Over towering the East Side tenements are the Grand Central skyscrapers, prominent of which are the 10 E. 40th Street Bldg. (left) and the Chanin Bldg. (right). Note the Hotel Commodore to the right of the latter.

September 11, 1931.
P.L. Sperr
